byline.contributor: Christopher Buckley contributed reporting from Beijing.

abstract: Pres-elect Donald Trump defends his controversial congratulatory phone call to Taiwanese Pres Tsai Ing-wen and says America is not bound to One China Policy, 1979 agreement that switched diplomatic recognition from Taiwan to People's Republic; Trump's comments in Fox News broadcast imply he may use policy as bargaining chip for trade and security concessions from Beijing.
lead_paragraph: Defending his recent phone call with Taiwan’s president, Mr. Trump said the United States was not bound by the One China policy, a 44-year diplomatic understanding.
snippet: Defending his recent phone call with Taiwan’s president, Mr. Trump said the United States was not bound by the One China policy, a 44-year diplomatic understanding....

headline.main: Trump Suggests Using Bedrock China Policy as Bargaining Chip
headline.print_headline: Defending Taiwan Call, Trump Suggests U.S. Isn’t Bound by Longtime China Policy
